response.original_title: Phantom RAF - Der ungelöste Fall Herrhausen
response.overview: On November 30, 1989, Alfred Herrhausen, CEO of Deutsche Bank, set off in his armored limousine for Frankfurt. At 8:34 a.m., the attack took place. Herrhausen, a top manager with threat level one, was killed instantly. Near the scene of the crime: paper with RAF emblem. Hidden in the bushes: the detonating mechanism of a bomb. An unprecedented, technically sophisticated attack. To this day, the case raises questions: Who were the perpetrators? Why was Herrhausen targeted? To what extent are international terrorist groups involved in the case?
response.title: Phantom RAF - The unsolved Herrhausen case

results.name: Fernsehtrailer: „Phantom RAF - Der ungelöste Fall Herrhausen“
